intro: Tunilla corrugata, commonly known as the roughleaf tunilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves that are often covered in a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in temperate climates. Tunilla corrugata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
